Source code (Git)

The project repositories are at the Apache Software Foundation. These Apache repositories are mirrored back to GitHub (read-only), which is practical for sending patches via usual GitHub forking and pull requests.

Note:

The project has graduated from the Apache Incubation only recently (2018-03-21), and so you still need to add incubator- before the repository names.

The key repositories are:

  • freemarker: The engine itself (i.e., freemarker.jar) and the documentation. URL: https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator-freemarker.git. GitHub mirror: https://github.com/apache/incubator-freemarker. Relevant branches (as of 2015-09-04):

    • 2.3-gae: FreeMarker 2.3.x Google App Engine compliant variant. Develop here by default! This is where most developments are committed, and are then merged into the other two branches below.

    • 2.3: FreeMarker 2.3.x, "normal" variant (this is what most users use). We hardly ever commit into this directly, instead changes are coming from2.3-gae via merging.

    • 3: FreeMarker 3.x.x. The next generation of FreeMarker, heavily under development. More about FreeMarker 3...

  • freemarker-site: Web site (freemarker.apache.org) contents. URL: https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator-freemarker-site.git. GitHub mirror: https://github.com/apache/incubator-freemarker-site. Relevant branches: master

  • freemarker-docgen: DocBook transformation used for generating both the FreeMarker Manual and the Web site. URL: https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator-freemarker-docgen.git. GitHub mirror: https://github.com/apache/incubator-freemarker-docgen. Relevant branches: master

  • freemarker-online-tester: The service behind http://try.freemarker.org/. URL: https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator-freemarker-online-tester.git. GitHub mirror: https://github.com/apache/incubator-freemarker-online-tester. Relevant branches: master

There are some other FreeMarker-related repositories, such FMPP and Tutorials, which you can only find on the old GitHub project page, as they aren't part of the ongoing Apache Incubation effort.
